description: {"blocks":[{"key":"bcbbf","text":"This protocol is for generating a single cell suspension suitable for isolation of intestine-specific cells through Fluorescence Activated Cell Sorting (FACS) from L1 stage C. elegans. This protocol utilizes treatment with SDS-DTT solution and Pronase E to disrupt the cuticle. Worms are mechanically homogenized with a dounce homogenizer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":173,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: Bridge to Doctorate at Colorado State University

keywords: C. elegans, intestine, FACS, single cell suspension, cell dissociation,L1 stage
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"19tuo","text":"Strains:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6m5i0","text":"- FACS control C. elegans strain, i.e. N2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":15,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dp9ot","text":"- FACS sorting C. elegans strain, i.e. JM149 caIs71[elt-2p::GFP::HIS-2B::unc-54 3'UTR + rol-6(su1006)]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":15,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":45,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d417c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23k9k","text":"Reagents:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ajt0k","text":"L15-10 solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amreo","text":"- Leibovitz's L-15 Medium (Thermo 21083027)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6u57e","text":"- Fetal Bovine Serum (heat inactivated) (Thermo 10438026)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"kqpr","text":"- 100X Penicillin Streptomycin solution (Thermo 15140148)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"57r1i","text":"- Sucrose powder","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2rqig","text":"Stock solutions for egg buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f1do5","text":"- 2M NaCl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dkrvc","text":"- 2M KCl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31h5u","text":"- 1M CaCl2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6kepp","text":"- 1M MgCl2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9il05","text":"- 1M HEPES pH 7.2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"glfh","text":"Enzymes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"el1j4","text":"- Pronase E, Protease from Streptomyces griseus (Sigma P8811-1G)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7nk7t","text":"SDS-DTT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4h2tv","text":"- 1M DTT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56il4","text":"- 10% SDS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1a5fm","text":"- 1M HEPES pH8","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ep7do","text":"- 60% sucrose","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bl4pn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7aaje","text":"Consumables:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5p4nd","text":"- standard 1.5 ml tubes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efcb5","text":"- Stericup 0.2 micron filter (Fisher S2GPU05RE)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2e5em","text":"- 20-micron mesh filter (Fisher Scientific NC1004201)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cnq7d","text":"- 35-micron nylon mesh filter caps (Stellar Scientific FSC-FLTCP)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bh51j","text":"- 5 ml sterile polypropylene round-bottom tube (STEMCELL Technologies 38057)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9siij","text":"- Bio-Rad TC20 automated cell counting slide (Bio-rad 1450011)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4e1k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fn11m","text":"Equipment:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"65knp","text":"- Fixed angle rotor centrifuge (Eppendorf 5424)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eq9im","text":"- Swinging bucket rotor refrigerated centrifuge (eppendorf 5810R) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7fnln","text":"- 15 ml tube and 1.5 ml tube adapter (eppendorf 022638704, eppendorf 022638742)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqnpe","text":"- Fluorescent microscope","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvqdm","text":"- Nutating mixer ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cff4l","text":"- Bio-Rad TC20 automated cell counter","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55f15","text":"- 2ml dounce homogenizer with pestle A (Sigma-Aldrich D8938)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"70vrr","text":"Prepare reagents in advance","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9j84r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"78ldc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e6isk","text":"L15-10 Buffer: Mix 500 ml Leibovitz's L-15 Medium, 50 ml Fetal Bovine Serum (heat inactivated), 50 ul of 100x Penicillin-Streptomycin solution and 7.7 g sucrose. Filter with 0.2 micron pore filter. Store at 4ºC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmjp2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39vj4","text":"Egg Buffer: Mix 29.5 ml of 2M NaCl, 12 ml of 2M KCl, 1 ml of 1M CaCl2, 1 ml of MgCl2, 12.5 ml of 1M HEPES-NaOH pH 7.2 and 435 ml molecular grade water. Filter with 0.2 micron pore filter. Store at 4ºC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1lv3n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fq38q","text":"Pronase E solution (15 mg/ml): Weigh 150 mg of Protease from Streptomyces griseus (Sigma P8811-1G) into a 15 ml tube. Dissolve the enzyme in 10 ml of Egg Buffer. Nutate the solution for approximately 10 minutes until dissolved. Prepare 1 ml aliquots in 1.5 ml tubes. Store aliquots at -20ºC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b9cb2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"p3j8","text":"SDS-DTT solution: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"26p77","text":"To ensure treatment efficacy, the SDS-DTT solution is prepared fresh on the day of the experiment. Additionally, several aliquots of DTT powder in 1.5 ml tubes are prepared in advance and stored at -20ºC. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4d6je","text":"To prepare the SDS-DTT solution, first resuspend 154 mg of DTT powder with 1 mL of Egg Buffer on the day of the experiment. Then, combine the following reagents in a 15 ml tube (final concentrations in parenthesis): 100 uL of 1M HEPES pH8 (20 mM), 125 uL of 10% SDS (0.25%), 1 mL of 1M DTT (200 mM), 250 uL of 60% sucrose (3%), and 3.525 mL of molecular grade water for a final volume of 5 mL.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9fq8g","text":"The SDS-DTT solution is one of the most important reagents to ensure successful dissociation of post-embryonic worms. To check that the SDS-DTT solution is working properly, incubate worms in freshly prepared SDS-DTT solution under a dissection microscope. When prepared properly, worms should dissolve within ~10 minutes of observation.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"92lgr","text":"On day of protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fcf0b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hh8e","text":"Cool swinging bucket centrifuge to 4ºC","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lhcu","text":"Thaw pronase aliquots at room temperature","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2v41n","text":"Place L15-10 and egg buffer on ice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbr16","text":"Wash and sterilize dounce homogenizer and pestle A (1ml H20, 1ml 70% EtOH)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"phlv","text":"Starting material: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7l51l","text":"Worm suspension in 15 ml tube (material generated from this protocol)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":55,"length":13}],"data":{}},{"key":"5m0d2","text":"Strains: N2, fluorescent sorting strain","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vrds","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aom1h","text":"Perform this protocol on both strains in parallel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79eus","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9jt4g","text":"Note: The volumes for chemical and enzymatic treatments in this protocol require an L1 pellet less than 200 uL. If L1 pellet exceeds 200 ul, utilize 2x the L1 pellet volume.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"07F43B823B8311EDB7F00A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/synchronized-c-elegans-culture-on-ngm-plates-for-f-cgyxtxxn"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"84fvv","text":"Once the worm suspension is free of E. coli, centrifuge worm suspension at 2,000 rcf for 1 minute ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"hbn4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"200qt","text":"Resuspend the worm pellet in 1 ml of M9 and transfer to a 1.5 ml tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"a9tjo","text":"Pellet the worms again at 2,000 rcf for 1 minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ao5ki","text":"Transfer 10 ul of L1 worm pellet to 1ml of Qiazol and store at -80°C for downstream RNA analysis","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"53r8j","text":"Resuspend the worm pellet in 200 ul of fresh SDS-DTT solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"78js5","text":"Incubate for 2 min room temperature to digest the cuticle","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ao01","text":"NOTE: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4u1et","text":"- Worms should look ruffled, and pharynx should change from thin and elongated to short and round","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2u28q","text":"- Incubation exceeding 2 min will damage the sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"a4f9p","text":"Quench reaction by adding 800 ul of ice cold egg buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3kilh","text":"Pellet worms at 13,000 rcf for 15 seconds at 4ºC","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7flp5","text":"Decant the supernatant and replace with 1 ml of ice-cold egg buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1v51k","text":"Repeat the egg buffer wash for a total of 5 washes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"a27sd","text":"Resuspend the SDS-DTT treated worms in 200 ul of 15 mg/ml Pronase E","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a3484","text":"Incubate for 30 minutes at room temperature nutating to digest the cuticle","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"921n2","text":"Transfer the worm suspension to a 2 ml glass dounce homogenizer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"brijb","text":"Perform 100 strokes with dounce pestle A to generate a worm slurry","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"anlkt","text":"Visually confirm worm dissociation by viewing a 2 ul sample of worm slurry on a fluorescent microscope","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"90pvm","text":"Pellet undissociated worms at 100 rcf for 1 minute at 4ºC in swinging bucket centrifuge","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bfhh7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7t0g5","text":"NOTES:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4bsqo","text":"- This step will separate the dissociated cells from intact worms","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":16,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ukcp","text":"- Cells will remain in the supernatant","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7eq6","text":"- Intact and partially dissociated worms will remain in the pellet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpmrq","text":"- Ensure your cell type of interest is not lost during this step. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2bu9","text":"- Visually confirm fluorescent cells are present in the supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":37,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agrfb","text":"- Visually confirm fluorescent cells are not present in the pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":37,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"epjef","text":"- You may need to reduce the centrifuge speed and/or time if fluorescent cells are in the pellet of this step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d3ak1","text":"Load 10 ul of cell suspension to a Bio-Rad TC20 automated cell counting slide. Also can use a hemocytometer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1lb9i","text":"Dilute the sample to    if above this concentration with L15-10","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":21,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"","data":{"formula":"1 \\times 10^6 \\frac{\\text{cells}}{\\text{ml}}","guid":"F65CAF307B1311EC897E0A58A9FEAC02","id":0}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"195cf","text":"Microscopically confirm fluorescent cells are present in the cell counting slide","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"439jq","text":"This protocol should yield between   to    total cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":35,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":40,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1r59e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"2 \\times 10^6","guid":"D3610A307B1311EC991E03F4B83084ED","id":0}},"1":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"","data":{"formula":"4 \\times 10^6","guid":"ED004C0B7B1311EC897E0A58A9FEAC02","id":0}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"alcnn","text":"If the total cell yield is less than    cells and many intact worms remain, repeat the SDS-DTT, Pronase E and dounce homogenization steps","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":37,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"","data":{"formula":"1 \\times 10^6","guid":"1617F5EE7B1411EC897E0A58A9FEAC02","id":0}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"af6ad","text":"Quench the Pronase E treatment by adding 1 ml of L15-10","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e8jm4","text":"Pellet the worms at 13,000 rcf for 15 seconds at 4°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"aie4l","text":"Decant the supernatant and resuspend the worms in 1 ml of L15-10","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1i329","text":"Pellet the worms at 13,000 rcf for 15 seconds at 4°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e4jtr","text":"Resuspend the worms in 1ml of L15-10","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cesu6","text":"Aspirate 1 ml of the cell-containing supernatant. Keep the pipette away from the pelleted worm debris.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9s2go","text":"Dispense the cell suspension though a 35-micron nylon mesh filter into a 5 ml flow cytometry tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"aedc0","text":"Resuspend remaining worm slurry in 1ml of L15-10","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ce5te","text":"- Transfer 70 ul of cells to 1 ml of Qiazol and store at -80°C for downstream RNA analysis","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"770p3","text":"- Continue to step 31","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2g86f","text":"- Retain the remaining ~2ml of cells for FACS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":41,"length":4}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"659D68903B8411ED903385FAA0CEA4B8","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/facs-isolation-of-intestine-specific-c-elegans-cel-b36zqrf6"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"58n55","text":"Harvest the synchronized L1 worms by washing the plates with fresh M9. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5edd5","text":"Pass the harvested L1 suspension through a 20 micron filter. This will filter any contaminating debris (agar chunks, partially bleached worm chunks) and any unhatched or dead embryos.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"btakh","text":"Pellet the worms in a 15 ml tube for 1 min at 2,000 rcf. Discard the supernatant and repeat M9 washes until the supernatant is free of visible E. coli.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"65erk","text":"Harvest the cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5usfh","text":"Transfer worm slurry to 1 ml centrifuge tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7vqhf","text":"For the sorting strain, perform an additional round of dissociation and cell harvest (Steps 24-28). You will perform a total of two to three homogenization cycles, until few intact worms remain.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8dgag","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fdine","text":"Total cell suspension volumes:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"78koi","text":"- Control strain = 1ml","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9cv0","text":"- Sorting strain = 2-3ml","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7mqo8","text":"Move on to FACS protocol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":11,"length":13}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"4655E6B03B8411ED903385FAA0CEA4B8","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/facs-isolation-of-intestine-specific-c-elegans-cel-b36zqrf6"}}}}

title: L1 stage C. elegans dissociation for FACS isolation and RNA-seq analysis of intestine-specific cells
title_html: L1 stage C. elegans dissociation for FACS isolation and RNA-seq analysis of intestine-specific cells

versions.title: L1 stage C. elegans dissociation for FACS isolation and RNA-seq analysis of intestine-specific cells
versions.title_html: L1 stage C. elegans dissociation for FACS isolation and RNA-seq analysis of intestine-specific cells

versions.title: L1 stage C. elegans dissociation for FACS isolation and RNA-seq analysis of intestine-specific cells
versions.title_html: L1 stage C. elegans dissociation for FACS isolation and RNA-seq analysis of intestine-specific cells
